meanings.definition: The involuntary constriction and relaxation of the muscles of the intestine or another canal, creating wavelike movements that push the contents of the canal forward.
meanings.sent1: During peristalses, the muscles in the intestine contract and relax to move food along.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how peristalses help in pushing food through the digestive system.
meanings.sent3: The peristalses in the intestines decided to have a race to see who could move the food faster.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like the peristalses of the digestive tract, relentless and unstoppable.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic peristalses of the intestines were like a gentle wave carrying food along.

meanings.definition: The series of wave-like muscle contractions that moves food through the digestive tract.
meanings.sent1: The peristalses in the digestive tract help in the smooth movement of food.
meanings.sent2: Food travels through the digestive tract due to the peristalses of the muscles.
meanings.sent3: The peristalses in the stomach were having a dance party to celebrate their efficient work.
meanings.sent4: The peristalses of the digestive system were like a conveyor belt, ensuring food reaches its destination.
meanings.sent5: The peristalses of the intestines were like a gentle massage, aiding in digestion.
